summary:
• A German national was sentenced to death in Belarus.
• The sentence has sparked controversy due to unknown circumstances surrounding the case.
• Questions remain about the fairness of the trial and potential human rights violations.

• Celine Dion is back on stage after her health struggles.
• A massive wildfire has destroyed parts of the beautiful Canadian city of Jasper in the Rocky Mountains.
• Canadians are becoming increasingly disappointed with their Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau.
• Over 170 wildfires are currently burning across the province of Alberta.

• A Chinese company has been aiding Russia in its war with Ukraine through its machine tools.
• The tools have played a crucial role in Russia's military campaign, enabling them to target Ukrainian forces effectively.
• This partnership between China and Russia highlights the growing ties between the two nations despite international sanctions imposed on Russia.

• The Paris 2024 opening ceremony was lit up in a unique way
• Chaos occurred in Paris due to rail sabotage during the opening of the Olympics
• Arson attacks targeted France’s high-speed trains just hours before the Olympics began

• The Dublin Wax Museum has removed its Sinead O'Connor figure
• The exact reason for removal is unclear
• Fans have expressed disappointment at the decision

• Thousands protested during Netanyahu's address to the US Congress.
• Israel recovered the bodies of five hostages amidst delays in ongoing negotiations regarding an agreement.
• No additional information is provided beyond these three key points.

• Japan's last atomic bomb survivors urge "atomic bomb hell" must never be repeated.
• They warn against repeating such atrocities in the future.
• The survivors stress that humanity must learn from its mistakes to prevent similar disasters.

• Mexico was not informed about the arrest of top Sinaloa cartel leaders.
• The arrested leaders include the sons of El Chapo.
• These arrests will impact the operations of the Sinaloa cartel.

• Family members who went to assist in rescue efforts after a landslide tragically lost their lives.
• The incident highlights the risks faced by those attempting to aid others during natural disasters.
• It serves as a poignant reminder of the importance of caution when responding to emergencies.

• People were rescued in the Philippines amid flooding caused by Typhoon.
• Shops and streets were inundated with floodwaters due to the typhoon.
• The rescue operation aimed to evacuate people from flooded areas.

• Mass killer dies in prison
• Victims continue to demand justice
• Demand for accountability remains strong

• The increasing use of drones in Ukraine's conflict highlights their potential to revolutionize modern warfare.
• Drones offer tactical advantages such as surveillance, reconnaissance, and precision strikes, which could influence how wars are fought in the future.
• As drone technology advances, it may also lead to new challenges and opportunities for military strategy and international law.

• UK ends opposition to ICC arrest warrants for Israeli leaders
• Police violence sparks protests after kicking passenger in airport video
• New British state company to build offshore wind farms on King's seabed
• Archaeologists find century-old wreck carrying 100 champagne bottles

• J.D. Vance defends his "childless cat ladies" comment amid backlash.
• El Chapo's brother, El Mayo, arrested in the US after 35 years on the run.
• President Trump attempts to end Kamala Harris' honeymoon with three strategies.
• US court rules that some "boneless" chicken wings may contain bones.
• A car drives through a wildfire in California.
• Joe Biden delivers key speeches after withdrawing from presidential race.
• Details emerge about Trump's security team failure to protect him from a shooter.
• Justin Timberlake is said not to be drunk at the time of his arrest.
• Kamala Harris requests an immediate ceasefire and hostage release after her meeting with Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

• Venezuela holds elections on Sunday.
• Could real change be coming?
• Is this the beginning of the end for the Maduro regime in Venezuela?
